p: Initially, it was a challenge for us to identify P. latifolia because there were two similar species within proximity to its type locality. However, after chemical characterization, we were compelled to make a closer examination of the morphology and realised that one of the taxa constitutes a new species, which we have ascribed the phrase name P. sp. Barren Mountain (BNM-1, -2 and -3). This latter taxon produced an essential oil comprised by 65â€“80% of prostantherol + ledol, which is very similar to that produced by P. petraea B.J.Conn. ( Table 5). Alternatively, P. latifolia expresses an essential oil that includes borneol, bornanone (camphor) and bornyl acetate as previously mentioned.
